      • getReceiver

        public java.lang.Object getReceiver()
        This method takes the receiver from the member's ReflectClass. If the receiver does not match the class where this member was declared, it start searching parent instances to find the correct receiver for this member.

        This action will handle cases where a member was found based on a nested class.
        Specified by:
        getReceiver in class ReflectObject<java.lang.reflect.Member>

      • tieReceiver

        public java.lang.Object tieReceiver(java.lang.Object receiver)
        This method will match a receiver to this member. If it does not match, it will search for parent receivers until a match is found.

        Perhaps the receiver belongs to a nested class and this member was declared in an outer class. This method will in this case return the receiver for the outer class where the member was declared.
        Parameters:
        receiver - A new parent receiver or the same
